summary: This document is an email chain from January 2023, showing a survivor or advocate expressing frustration with attorney James R. Marsh about delays in filing a claim against the FBI related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. The writer references a large number of victims and a new victim from 1991, while Marsh cites his workload with Catholic Church abuse cases.

persons.name: James R. Marsh
persons.context: Attorney at Marsh Law Firm PLLC who is being pressed by a survivor/advocate to file a claim against the FBI on behalf of Epstein survivors. He explains he is busy with other abuse cases.

persons.name: Bob
persons.context: Mentioned by James Marsh as one of the 'excellent lawyers' at his firm.

persons.name: Jennifer
persons.context: Mentioned by James Marsh as one of the 'excellent lawyers' at his firm.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by the email writer as having 'raped over a thousand children and young women' and whose associates ('Epstein and Co') are the subject of the proposed legal claim.

connections.description: Colleagues at the Marsh Law Firm PLLC, as Marsh references Bob as one of the firm's excellent lawyers.
Colleagues at the Marsh Law Firm PLLC, as Marsh references Jennifer as one of the firm's excellent lawyers.
Marsh is an attorney being solicited to represent survivors of Jeffrey Epstein in a legal claim, indicating a potential attorney-client relationship with victims against Epstein's interests.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein claim
events.description: An email exchange where a survivor/advocate pressures attorney James Marsh to file a legal claim against the FBI on behalf of Epstein survivors, citing new evidence from 1991.

events.title: Reference to 1991 victim
events.description: The email writer claims to now have a victim from 1991, suggesting an earlier timeline for Epstein's abuse.

keyFacts: An advocate or survivor is pressuring attorney James R. Marsh to file a claim against the FBI regarding the Epstein case, expressing frustration over delays.
The writer alleges 'Jeffrey Epstein and co have raped over a thousand children and young women,' emphasizing the scale of the abuse.
A new victim from 1991 is referenced, potentially extending the known timeline of Epstein's predatory behavior.
James Marsh cites his significant workload representing over 100 clients in cases against the Catholic Church as a reason for the delay.
